record.dc:title: 223MG31 Hiwassee Island Site 47MG31, Meigs County, Tennessee. 47MG31 - Burial mound. Burial 47MG8. Bones of burial completely disintegrated and nothing left except the artifacts located at the bottom of a pit. Square 3R2. Direction east.
record.wpa:narrative: These have been slightly rearranged, but position is essentially accurate. Six triangular projectile points and a group of miscellaneous worked stones including a crude celt. Associated with Mound Phase B. [Burial Feature 47MG8] This burial was entirely disintegrated, only a few yellowish lines indicating bones. It is the only burial encountered in the mound that had artifacts associated with it. The pit was roughly rectangular and originated at the top of Mound Phase B (see 3.5-line profile) and extended into subsoil for about 4' where the skeleton was deposited. This probably accounts for the complete disintegration of the skeleton. The pit was sunk from the sloping top of Mound Phase B as shown on the 3.5-line profile. The artifacts were deposited in two groups as shown. There was a slight trace of bone under the grave goods in the north end of the pit.
record.wpa:comments: Observer illustration on file at the institution.
